summary.long: Mark is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: This is the Good News about Jesus the Messiah, the Son of God. It began
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
just as the prophet Isaiah had written:
“Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you,
    and he will prepare your way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is a voice shouting in the wilderness,
‘Prepare the way for the Lord’s coming!
    Clear the road for him!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This messenger was John the Baptist. He was in the wilderness and preached that people should be baptized to show that they had repented of their sins and turned to God to be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of Judea, including all the people of Jerusalem, went out to see and hear John. And when they confessed their sins, he baptized them in the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His clothes were woven from coarse camel hair, and he wore a leather belt around his waist. For food he ate locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John announced: “Someone is coming soon who is greater than I am—so much greater that I’m not even worthy to stoop down like a slave and untie the straps of his sandals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I baptize you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee, and John baptized him in the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus came up out of the water, he saw the heavens splitting apart and the Holy Spirit descending on him like a dove.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a voice from heaven said, “You are my dearly loved Son, and you bring me great joy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit then compelled Jesus to go into the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where he was tempted by Satan for forty days. He was out among the wild animals, and angels took care of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later on, after John was arrested, Jesus went into Galilee, where he preached God’s Good News.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The time promised by God has come at last!” he announced. “The Kingdom of God is near! Repent of your sins and believe the Good News!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: One day as Jesus was walking along the shore of the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and his brother Andrew throwing a net into the water, for they fished for a living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called out to them, “Come, follow me, and I will show you how to fish for people!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And they left their nets at once and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A little farther up the shore Jesus saw Zebedee’s sons, James and John, in a boat repairing their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called them at once, and they also followed him, leaving their father, Zebedee, in the boat with the hired men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus and his companions went to the town of Capernaum. When the Sabbath day came, he went into the synagogue and began to teach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were amazed at his teaching, for he taught with real authority—quite unlike the teachers of religious law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, a man in the synagogue who was possessed by an evil spirit cried out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why are you interfering with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus reprimanded him. “Be quiet! Come out of the man,” he ordered.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: At that, the evil spirit screamed, threw the man into a convulsion, and then came out of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amazement gripped the audience, and they began to discuss what had happened. “What sort of new teaching is this?” they asked excitedly. “It has such authority! Even evil spirits obey his orders!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The news about Jesus spread quickly throughout the entire region of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus left the synagogue with James and John, they went to Simon and Andrew’s home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Simon’s mother-in-law was sick in bed with a high fever. They told Jesus about her right away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went to her bedside, took her by the hand, and helped her sit up. Then the fever left her, and she prepared a meal for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That evening after sunset, many sick and demon-possessed people were brought to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole town gathered at the door to watch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus healed many people who were sick with various diseases, and he cast out many demons. But because the demons knew who he was, he did not allow them to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before daybreak the next morning, Jesus got up and went out to an isolated place to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later Simon and the others went out to find him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they found him, they said, “Everyone is looking for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus replied, “We must go on to other towns as well, and I will preach to them, too. That is why I came.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So he traveled throughout the region of Galilee, preaching in the synagogues and casting out demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man with leprosy came and knelt in front of Jesus, begging to be healed. “If you are willing, you can heal me and make me clean,” he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moved with compassion, Jesus reached out and touched him. “I am willing,” he said. “Be healed!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Instantly the leprosy disappeared, and the man was healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus sent him on his way with a stern warning:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t tell anyone about this. Instead, go to the priest and let him examine you. Take along the offering required in the law of Moses for those who have been healed of leprosy. This will be a public testimony that you have been cleansed.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the man went and spread the word, proclaiming to everyone what had happened. As a result, large crowds soon surrounded Jesus, and he couldn’t publicly enter a town anywhere. He had to stay out in the secluded places, but people from everywhere kept coming to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus returned to Capernaum several days later, the news spread quickly that he was back home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon the house where he was staying was so packed with visitors that there was no more room, even outside the door. While he was preaching God’s word to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: four men arrived carrying a paralyzed man on a mat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They couldn’t bring him to Jesus because of the crowd, so they dug a hole through the roof above his head. Then they lowered the man on his mat, right down in front of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing their faith, Jesus said to the paralyzed man, “My child, your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But some of the teachers of religious law who were sitting there thought to themselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What is he saying? This is blasphemy! Only God can forgive sins!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew immediately what they were thinking, so he asked them, “Why do you question this in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Is it easier to say to the paralyzed man ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or ‘Stand up, pick up your mat, and walk’?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So I will prove to you that the Son of Man has the authority on earth to forgive sins.” Then Jesus turned to the paralyzed man and said,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Stand up, pick up your mat, and go home!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the man jumped up, grabbed his mat, and walked out through the stunned onlookers. They were all amazed and praised God, exclaiming, “We’ve never seen anything like this before!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went out to the lakeshore again and taught the crowds that were coming to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he walked along, he saw Levi son of Alphaeus sitting at his tax collector’s booth. “Follow me and be my disciple,” Jesus said to him. So Levi got up and followed him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Later, Levi invited Jesus and his disciples to his home as dinner guests, along with many tax collectors and other disreputable sinners. (There were many people of this kind among Jesus’ followers.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the teachers of religious law who were Pharisees saw him eating with tax collectors and other sinners, they asked his disciples, “Why does he eat with such scum?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard this, he told them, “Healthy people don’t need a doctor—sick people do. I have come to call not those who think they are righteous, but those who know they are sinners.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Once when John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting, some people came to Jesus and asked, “Why don’t your disciples fast like John’s disciples and the Pharisees do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Do wedding guests fast while celebrating with the groom? Of course not. They can’t fast while the groom is with them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But someday the groom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Besides, who would patch old clothing with new cloth? For the new patch would shrink and rip away from the old cloth, leaving an even bigger tear than before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And no one puts new wine into old wineskins. For the wine would burst the wineskins, and the wine and the skins would both be lost. New wine calls for new wineskins.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: One Sabbath day as Jesus was walking through some grainfields, his disciples began breaking off heads of grain to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees said to Jesus, “Look, why are they breaking the law by harvesting grain on the Sabbath?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Haven’t you ever read in the Scriptures what David did when he and his companions were hungry?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He went into the house of God (during the days when Abiathar was high priest) and broke the law by eating the sacred loaves of bread that only the priests are allowed to eat. He also gave some to his companions.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “The Sabbath was made to meet the needs of people, and not people to meet the requirements of the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So the Son of Man is Lord, even over the Sabbath!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus went into the synagogue again and noticed a man with a deformed hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since it was the Sabbath, Jesus’ enemies watched him closely. If he healed the man’s hand, they planned to accuse him of working on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to the man with the deformed hand, “Come and stand in front of everyone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he turned to his critics and asked, “Does the law permit good deeds on the Sabbath, or is it a day for doing evil? Is this a day to save life or to destroy it?” But they wouldn’t answer him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked around at them angrily and was deeply saddened by their hard hearts. Then he said to the man, “Hold out your hand.” So the man held out his hand, and it was restored!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once the Pharisees went away and met with the supporters of Herod to plot how to kill Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went out to the lake with his disciples, and a large crowd followed him. They came from all over Galilee, Judea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerusalem, Idumea, from east of the Jordan River, and even from as far north as Tyre and Sidon. The news about his miracles had spread far and wide, and vast numbers of people came to see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus instructed his disciples to have a boat ready so the crowd would not crush him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had healed many people that day, so all the sick people eagerly pushed forward to touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whenever those possessed by evil spirits caught sight of him, the spirits would throw them to the ground in front of him shrieking, “You are the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus sternly commanded the spirits not to reveal who he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward Jesus went up on a mountain and called out the ones he wanted to go with him. And they came to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he appointed twelve of them and called them his apostles. They were to accompany him, and he would send them out to preach,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: giving them authority to cast out demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are the twelve he chose:
Simon (whom he named Peter),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: James and John (the sons of Zebedee, but Jesus nicknamed them “Sons of Thunder”),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Andrew,
Philip,
Bartholomew,
Matthew,
Thomas,
James (son of Alphaeus),
Thaddaeus,
Simon (the zealot),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas Iscariot (who later betrayed him).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One time Jesus entered a house, and the crowds began to gather again. Soon he and his disciples couldn’t even find time to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his family heard what was happening, they tried to take him away. “He’s out of his mind,” they said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the teachers of religious law who had arrived from Jerusalem said, “He’s possessed by Satan, the prince of demons. That’s where he gets the power to cast out demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called them over and responded with an illustration. “How can Satan cast out Satan?” he asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A kingdom divided by civil war will collapse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Similarly, a family splintered by feuding will fall apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if Satan is divided and fights against himself, how can he stand? He would never survive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let me illustrate this further. Who is powerful enough to enter the house of a strong man and plunder his goods? Only someone even stronger—someone who could tie him up and then plunder his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you the truth, all sin and blasphemy can be forgiven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but anyone who blasphemes the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven. This is a sin with eternal consequences.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them this because they were saying, “He’s possessed by an evil spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus’ mother and brothers came to see him. They stood outside and sent word for him to come out and talk with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a crowd sitting around Jesus, and someone said, “Your mother and your brothers are outside asking for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Who is my mother? Who are my brothers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he looked at those around him and said, “Look, these are my mother and brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who does God’s will is my brother and sister and mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once again Jesus began teaching by the lakeshore. A very large crowd soon gathered around him, so he got into a boat. Then he sat in the boat while all the people remained on the shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taught them by telling many stories in the form of parables, such as this one:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen! A farmer went out to plant some seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he scattered it across his field, some of the seed fell on a footpath, and the birds came and ate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seed fell on shallow soil with underlying rock. The seed sprouted quickly because the soil was shallow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the plant soon wilted under the hot sun, and since it didn’t have deep roots, it died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seed fell among thorns that grew up and choked out the tender plants so they produced no grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still other seeds fell on fertile soil, and they sprouted, grew, and produced a crop that was thirty, sixty, and even a hundred times as much as had been planted!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Anyone with ears to hear should listen and understand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, when Jesus was alone with the twelve disciples and with the others who were gathered around, they asked him what the parables meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “You are permitted to understand the secret of the Kingdom of God. But I use parables for everything I say to outsiders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that the Scriptures might be fulfilled:
‘When they see what I do,
    they will learn nothing.
When they hear what I say,
    they will not understand.
Otherwise, they will turn to me
    and be forgiven.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “If you can’t understand the meaning of this parable, how will you understand all the other parables?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The farmer plants seed by taking God’s word to others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seed that fell on the footpath represents those who hear the message, only to have Satan come at once and take it away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seed on the rocky soil represents those who hear the message and immediately receive it with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since they don’t have deep roots, they don’t last long. They fall away as soon as they have problems or are persecuted for believing God’s word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seed that fell among the thorns represents others who hear God’s word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but all too quickly the message is crowded out by the worries of this life, the lure of wealth, and the desire for other things, so no fruit is produced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the seed that fell on good soil represents those who hear and accept God’s word and produce a harvest of thirty, sixty, or even a hundred times as much as had been planted!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus asked them, “Would anyone light a lamp and then put it under a basket or under a bed? Of course not! A lamp is placed on a stand, where its light will shine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everything that is hidden will eventually be brought into the open, and every secret will be brought to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone with ears to hear should listen and understand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he added, “Pay close attention to what you hear. The closer you listen, the more understanding you will be given—and you will receive even more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To those who listen to my teaching, more understanding will be given. But for those who are not listening, even what little understanding they have will be taken away from them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus also said, “The Kingdom of God is like a farmer who scatters seed on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Night and day, while he’s asleep or awake, the seed sprouts and grows, but he does not understand how it happens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth produces the crops on its own. First a leaf blade pushes through, then the heads of wheat are formed, and finally the grain ripens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as the grain is ready, the farmer comes and harvests it with a sickle, for the harvest time has come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “How can I describe the Kingdom of God? What story should I use to illustrate it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a mustard seed planted in the ground. It is the smallest of all seeds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but it becomes the largest of all garden plants; it grows long branches, and birds can make nests in its shade.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus used many similar stories and illustrations to teach the people as much as they could understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, in his public ministry he never taught without using parables; but afterward, when he was alone with his disciples, he explained everything to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As evening came, Jesus said to his disciples, “Let’s cross to the other side of the lake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took Jesus in the boat and started out, leaving the crowds behind (although other boats followed).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But soon a fierce storm came up. High waves were breaking into the boat, and it began to fill with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was sleeping at the back of the boat with his head on a cushion. The disciples woke him up, shouting, “Teacher, don’t you care that we’re going to drown?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus woke up, he rebuked the wind and said to the waves, “Silence! Be still!” Suddenly the wind stopped, and there was a great calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he asked them, “Why are you afraid? Do you still have no faith?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were absolutely terrified. “Who is this man?” they asked each other. “Even the wind and waves obey him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they arrived at the other side of the lake, in the region of the Gerasenes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus climbed out of the boat, a man possessed by an evil spirit came out from the tombs to meet him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man lived in the burial caves and could no longer be restrained, even with a chain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever he was put into chains and shackles—as he often was—he snapped the chains from his wrists and smashed the shackles. No one was strong enough to subdue him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Day and night he wandered among the burial caves and in the hills, howling and cutting himself with sharp stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus was still some distance away, the man saw him, ran to meet him, and bowed low before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With a shriek, he screamed, “Why are you interfering with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? In the name of God, I beg you, don’t torture me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jesus had already said to the spirit, “Come out of the man, you evil spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus demanded, “What is your name?”
And he replied, “My name is Legion, because there are many of us inside this man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the evil spirits begged him again and again not to send them to some distant place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There happened to be a large herd of pigs feeding on the hillside nearby.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Send us into those pigs,” the spirits begged. “Let us enter them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus gave them permission. The evil spirits came out of the man and entered the pigs, and the entire herd of about 2,000 pigs plunged down the steep hillside into the lake and drowned in the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The herdsmen fled to the nearby town and the surrounding countryside, spreading the news as they ran. People rushed out to see what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A crowd soon gathered around Jesus, and they saw the man who had been possessed by the legion of demons. He was sitting there fully clothed and perfectly sane, and they were all afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those who had seen what happened told the others about the demon-possessed man and the pigs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the crowd began pleading with Jesus to go away and leave them alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was getting into the boat, the man who had been demon possessed begged to go with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “No, go home to your family, and tell them everything the Lord has done for you and how merciful he has been.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man started off to visit the Ten Towns of that region and began to proclaim the great things Jesus had done for him; and everyone was amazed at what he told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus got into the boat again and went back to the other side of the lake, where a large crowd gathered around him on the shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a leader of the local synagogue, whose name was Jairus, arrived. When he saw Jesus, he fell at his feet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: pleading fervently with him. “My little daughter is dying,” he said. “Please come and lay your hands on her; heal her so she can live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went with him, and all the people followed, crowding around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman in the crowd had suffered for twelve years with constant bleeding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She had suffered a great deal from many doctors, and over the years she had spent everything she had to pay them, but she had gotten no better. In fact, she had gotten worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She had heard about Jesus, so she came up behind him through the crowd and touched his robe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For she thought to herself, “If I can just touch his robe, I will be healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the bleeding stopped, and she could feel in her body that she had been healed of her terrible condition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus realized at once that healing power had gone out from him, so he turned around in the crowd and asked, “Who touched my robe?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said to him, “Look at this crowd pressing around you. How can you ask, ‘Who touched me?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he kept on looking around to see who had done it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the frightened woman, trembling at the realization of what had happened to her, came and fell to her knees in front of him and told him what she had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace. Your suffering is over.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking to her, messengers arrived from the home of Jairus, the leader of the synagogue. They told him, “Your daughter is dead. There’s no use troubling the Teacher now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus overheard them and said to Jairus, “Don’t be afraid. Just have faith.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus stopped the crowd and wouldn’t let anyone go with him except Peter, James, and John (the brother of James).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the home of the synagogue leader, Jesus saw much commotion and weeping and wailing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went inside and asked, “Why all this commotion and weeping? The child isn’t dead; she’s only asleep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd laughed at him. But he made them all leave, and he took the girl’s father and mother and his three disciples into the room where the girl was lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Holding her hand, he said to her, “Talitha koum,” which means “Little girl, get up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the girl, who was twelve years old, immediately stood up and walked around! They were overwhelmed and totally amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus gave them strict orders not to tell anyone what had happened, and then he told them to give her something to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus left that part of the country and returned with his disciples to Nazareth, his hometown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next Sabbath he began teaching in the synagogue, and many who heard him were amazed. They asked, “Where did he get all this wisdom and the power to perform such miracles?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they scoffed, “He’s just a carpenter, the son of Mary and the brother of James, Joseph, Judas, and Simon. And his sisters live right here among us.” They were deeply offended and refused to believe in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told them, “A prophet is honored everywhere except in his own hometown and among his relatives and his own family.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because of their unbelief, he couldn’t do any miracles among them except to place his hands on a few sick people and heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he was amazed at their unbelief.
Then Jesus went from village to village, teaching the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called his twelve disciples together and began sending them out two by two, giving them authority to cast out evil spirits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them to take nothing for their journey except a walking stick—no food, no traveler’s bag, no money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He allowed them to wear sandals but not to take a change of clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Wherever you go,” he said, “stay in the same house until you leave town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if any place refuses to welcome you or listen to you, shake its dust from your feet as you leave to show that you have abandoned those people to their fate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples went out, telling everyone they met to repent of their sins and turn to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they cast out many demons and healed many sick people, anointing them with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod Antipas, the king, soon heard about Jesus, because everyone was talking about him. Some were saying, “This must be John the Baptist raised from the dead. That is why he can do such miracles.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said, “He’s the prophet Elijah.” Still others said, “He’s a prophet like the other great prophets of the past.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod heard about Jesus, he said, “John, the man I beheaded, has come back from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Herod had sent soldiers to arrest and imprison John as a favor to Herodias. She had been his brother Philip’s wife, but Herod had married her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John had been telling Herod, “It is against God’s law for you to marry your brother’s wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Herodias bore a grudge against John and wanted to kill him. But without Herod’s approval she was powerless,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Herod respected John; and knowing that he was a good and holy man, he protected him. Herod was greatly disturbed whenever he talked with John, but even so, he liked to listen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herodias’s chance finally came on Herod’s birthday. He gave a party for his high government officials, army officers, and the leading citizens of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his daughter, also named Herodias, came in and performed a dance that greatly pleased Herod and his guests. “Ask me for anything you like,” the king said to the girl, “and I will give it to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He even vowed, “I will give you whatever you ask, up to half my kingdom!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She went out and asked her mother, “What should I ask for?”
Her mother told her, “Ask for the head of John the Baptist!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the girl hurried back to the king and told him, “I want the head of John the Baptist, right now, on a tray!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king deeply regretted what he had said; but because of the vows he had made in front of his guests, he couldn’t refuse her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he immediately sent an executioner to the prison to cut off John’s head and bring it to him. The soldier beheaded John in the prison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: brought his head on a tray, and gave it to the girl, who took it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When John’s disciples heard what had happened, they came to get his body and buried it in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles returned to Jesus from their ministry tour and told him all they had done and taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “Let’s go off by ourselves to a quiet place and rest awhile.” He said this because there were so many people coming and going that Jesus and his apostles didn’t even have time to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they left by boat for a quiet place, where they could be alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many people recognized them and saw them leaving, and people from many towns ran ahead along the shore and got there ahead of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw the huge crowd as he stepped from the boat, and he had compassion on them because they were like sheep without a shepherd. So he began teaching them many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Late in the afternoon his disciples came to him and said, “This is a remote place, and it’s already getting late.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send the crowds away so they can go to the nearby farms and villages and buy something to eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Jesus said, “You feed them.”
“With what?” they asked. “We’d have to work for months to earn enough money to buy food for all these people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How much bread do you have?” he asked. “Go and find out.”
They came back and reported, “We have five loaves of bread and two fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told the disciples to have the people sit down in groups on the green grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sat down in groups of fifty or a hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus took the five loaves and two fish, looked up toward heaven, and blessed them. Then, breaking the loaves into pieces, he kept giving the bread to the disciples so they could distribute it to the people. He also divided the fish for everyone to share.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate as much as they wanted,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and afterward, the disciples picked up twelve baskets of leftover bread and fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A total of 5,000 men and their families were fed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately after this, Jesus insisted that his disciples get back into the boat and head across the lake to Bethsaida, while he sent the people home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After telling everyone good-bye, he went up into the hills by himself to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Late that night, the disciples were in their boat in the middle of the lake, and Jesus was alone on land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw that they were in serious trouble, rowing hard and struggling against the wind and waves. About three o’clock in the morning Jesus came toward them, walking on the water. He intended to go past them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when they saw him walking on the water, they cried out in terror, thinking he was a ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were all terrified when they saw him.
But Jesus spoke to them at once. “Don’t be afraid,” he said. “Take courage! I am here!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he climbed into the boat, and the wind stopped. They were totally amazed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they still didn’t understand the significance of the miracle of the loaves. Their hearts were too hard to take it in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had crossed the lake, they landed at Gennesaret. They brought the boat to shore
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and climbed out. The people recognized Jesus at once,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they ran throughout the whole area, carrying sick people on mats to wherever they heard he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever he went—in villages, cities, or the countryside—they brought the sick out to the marketplaces. They begged him to let the sick touch at least the fringe of his robe, and all who touched him were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day some Pharisees and teachers of religious law arrived from Jerusalem to see Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They noticed that some of his disciples failed to follow the Jewish ritual of hand washing before eating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The Jews, especially the Pharisees, do not eat until they have poured water over their cupped hands, as required by their ancient traditions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Similarly, they don’t eat anything from the market until they immerse their hands in water. This is but one of many traditions they have clung to—such as their ceremonial washing of cups, pitchers, and kettles.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Pharisees and teachers of religious law asked him, “Why don’t your disciples follow our age-old tradition? They eat without first performing the hand-washing ceremony.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus replied, “You hypocrites! Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you, for he wrote,
‘These people honor me with their lips,
    but their hearts are far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their worship is a farce,
    for they teach man-made ideas as commands from God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you ignore God’s law and substitute your own tradition.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “You skillfully sidestep God’s law in order to hold on to your own tradition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For instance, Moses gave you this law from God: ‘Honor your father and mother,’ and ‘Anyone who speaks disrespectfully of father or mother must be put to death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you say it is all right for people to say to their parents, ‘Sorry, I can’t help you. For I have vowed to give to God what I would have given to you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way, you let them disregard their needy parents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so you cancel the word of God in order to hand down your own tradition. And this is only one example among many others.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus called to the crowd to come and hear. “All of you listen,” he said, “and try to understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s not what goes into your body that defiles you; you are defiled by what comes from your heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went into a house to get away from the crowd, and his disciples asked him what he meant by the parable he had just used.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t you understand either?” he asked. “Can’t you see that the food you put into your body cannot defile you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Food doesn’t go into your heart, but only passes through the stomach and then goes into the sewer.” (By saying this, he declared that every kind of food is acceptable in God’s eyes.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then he added, “It is what comes from inside that defiles you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from within, out of a person’s heart, come evil thoughts, sexual immorality, theft, murder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: adultery, greed, wickedness, deceit, lustful desires, envy, slander, pride, and foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these vile things come from within; they are what defile you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus left Galilee and went north to the region of Tyre. He didn’t want anyone to know which house he was staying in, but he couldn’t keep it a secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Right away a woman who had heard about him came and fell at his feet. Her little girl was possessed by an evil spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and she begged him to cast out the demon from her daughter.
Since she was a Gentile, born in Syrian Phoenicia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told her, “First I should feed the children—my own family, the Jews. It isn’t right to take food from the children and throw it to the dogs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She replied, “That’s true, Lord, but even the dogs under the table are allowed to eat the scraps from the children’s plates.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Good answer!” he said. “Now go home, for the demon has left your daughter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she arrived home, she found her little girl lying quietly in bed, and the demon was gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus left Tyre and went up to Sidon before going back to the Sea of Galilee and the region of the Ten Towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A deaf man with a speech impediment was brought to him, and the people begged Jesus to lay his hands on the man to heal him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus led him away from the crowd so they could be alone. He put his fingers into the man’s ears. Then, spitting on his own fingers, he touched the man’s tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Looking up to heaven, he sighed and said, “Ephphatha,” which means, “Be opened!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instantly the man could hear perfectly, and his tongue was freed so he could speak plainly!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told the crowd not to tell anyone, but the more he told them not to, the more they spread the news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were completely amazed and said again and again, “Everything he does is wonderful. He even makes the deaf to hear and gives speech to those who cannot speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About this time another large crowd had gathered, and the people ran out of food again. Jesus called his disciples and told them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I feel sorry for these people. They have been here with me for three days, and they have nothing left to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I send them home hungry, they will faint along the way. For some of them have come a long distance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples replied, “How are we supposed to find enough food to feed them out here in the wilderness?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus asked, “How much bread do you have?”
“Seven loaves,” they replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus told all the people to sit down on the ground. Then he took the seven loaves, thanked God for them, and broke them into pieces. He gave them to his disciples, who distributed the bread to the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A few small fish were found, too, so Jesus also blessed these and told the disciples to distribute them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ate as much as they wanted. Afterward, the disciples picked up seven large baskets of leftover food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were about 4,000 men in the crowd that day, and Jesus sent them home after they had eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately after this, he got into a boat with his disciples and crossed over to the region of Dalmanutha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Pharisees heard that Jesus had arrived, they came and started to argue with him. Testing him, they demanded that he show them a miraculous sign from heaven to prove his authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard this, he sighed deeply in his spirit and said, “Why do these people keep demanding a miraculous sign? I tell you the truth, I will not give this generation any such sign.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he got back into the boat and left them, and he crossed to the other side of the lake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the disciples had forgotten to bring any food. They had only one loaf of bread with them in the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were crossing the lake, Jesus warned them, “Watch out! Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and of Herod.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this they began to argue with each other because they hadn’t brought any bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew what they were saying, so he said, “Why are you arguing about having no bread? Don’t you know or understand even yet? Are your hearts too hard to take it in?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You have eyes—can’t you see? You have ears—can’t you hear?’ Don’t you remember anything at all?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I fed the 5,000 with five loaves of bread, how many baskets of leftovers did you pick up afterward?”
“Twelve,” they said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And when I fed the 4,000 with seven loaves, how many large baskets of leftovers did you pick up?”
“Seven,” they said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t you understand yet?” he asked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they arrived at Bethsaida, some people brought a blind man to Jesus, and they begged him to touch the man and heal him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus took the blind man by the hand and led him out of the village. Then, spitting on the man’s eyes, he laid his hands on him and asked, “Can you see anything now?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man looked around. “Yes,” he said, “I see people, but I can’t see them very clearly. They look like trees walking around.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus placed his hands on the man’s eyes again, and his eyes were opened. His sight was completely restored, and he could see everything clearly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sent him away, saying, “Don’t go back into the village on your way home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus and his disciples left Galilee and went up to the villages near Caesarea Philippi. As they were walking along, he asked them, “Who do people say I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Well,” they replied, “some say John the Baptist, some say Elijah, and others say you are one of the other prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he asked them, “But who do you say I am?”
Peter replied, “You are the Messiah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus warned them not to tell anyone about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus began to tell them that the Son of Man must suffer many terrible things and be rejected by the elders, the leading priests, and the teachers of religious law. He would be killed, but three days later he would rise from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he talked about this openly with his disciples, Peter took him aside and began to reprimand him for saying such things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus turned around and looked at his disciples, then reprimanded Peter. “Get away from me, Satan!” he said. “You are seeing things merely from a human point of view, not from God’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, calling the crowd to join his disciples, he said, “If any of you wants to be my follower, you must give up your own way, take up your cross, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you try to hang on to your life, you will lose it. But if you give up your life for my sake and for the sake of the Good News, you will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what do you benefit if you gain the whole world but lose your own soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is anything worth more than your soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone is ashamed of me and my message in these adulterous and sinful days, the Son of Man will be ashamed of that person when he returns in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went on to say, “I tell you the truth, some standing here right now will not die before they see the Kingdom of God arrive in great power!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days later Jesus took Peter, James, and John, and led them up a high mountain to be alone. As the men watched, Jesus’ appearance was transformed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his clothes became dazzling white, far whiter than any earthly bleach could ever make them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elijah and Moses appeared and began talking with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter exclaimed, “Rabbi, it’s wonderful for us to be here! Let’s make three shelters as memorials—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this because he didn’t really know what else to say, for they were all terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a cloud overshadowed them, and a voice from the cloud said, “This is my dearly loved Son. Listen to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, when they looked around, Moses and Elijah were gone, and they saw only Jesus with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went back down the mountain, he told them not to tell anyone what they had seen until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they kept it to themselves, but they often asked each other what he meant by “rising from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they asked him, “Why do the teachers of religious law insist that Elijah must return before the Messiah comes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus responded, “Elijah is indeed coming first to get everything ready. Yet why do the Scriptures say that the Son of Man must suffer greatly and be treated with utter contempt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you, Elijah has already come, and they chose to abuse him, just as the Scriptures predicted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they returned to the other disciples, they saw a large crowd surrounding them, and some teachers of religious law were arguing with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowd saw Jesus, they were overwhelmed with awe, and they ran to greet him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What is all this arguing about?” Jesus asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the men in the crowd spoke up and said, “Teacher, I brought my son so you could heal him. He is possessed by an evil spirit that won’t let him talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whenever this spirit seizes him, it throws him violently to the ground. Then he foams at the mouth and grinds his teeth and becomes rigid. So I asked your disciples to cast out the evil spirit, but they couldn’t do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “You faithless people! How long must I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring the boy to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought the boy. But when the evil spirit saw Jesus, it threw the child into a violent convulsion, and he fell to the ground, writhing and foaming at the mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How long has this been happening?” Jesus asked the boy’s father.
He replied, “Since he was a little boy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spirit often throws him into the fire or into water, trying to kill him. Have mercy on us and help us, if you can.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you mean, ‘If I can’?” Jesus asked. “Anything is possible if a person believes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The father instantly cried out, “I do believe, but help me overcome my unbelief!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw that the crowd of onlookers was growing, he rebuked the evil spirit. “Listen, you spirit that makes this boy unable to hear and speak,” he said. “I command you to come out of this child and never enter him again!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the spirit screamed and threw the boy into another violent convulsion and left him. The boy appeared to be dead. A murmur ran through the crowd as people said, “He’s dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus took him by the hand and helped him to his feet, and he stood up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward, when Jesus was alone in the house with his disciples, they asked him, “Why couldn’t we cast out that evil spirit?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “This kind can be cast out only by prayer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leaving that region, they traveled through Galilee. Jesus didn’t want anyone to know he was there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he wanted to spend more time with his disciples and teach them. He said to them, “The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of his enemies. He will be killed, but three days later he will rise from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They didn’t understand what he was saying, however, and they were afraid to ask him what he meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they arrived at Capernaum and settled in a house, Jesus asked his disciples, “What were you discussing out on the road?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they didn’t answer, because they had been arguing about which of them was the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sat down, called the twelve disciples over to him, and said, “Whoever wants to be first must take last place and be the servant of everyone else.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he put a little child among them. Taking the child in his arms, he said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Anyone who welcomes a little child like this on my behalf welcomes me, and anyone who welcomes me welcomes not only me but also my Father who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John said to Jesus, “Teacher, we saw someone using your name to cast out demons, but we told him to stop because he wasn’t in our group.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t stop him!” Jesus said. “No one who performs a miracle in my name will soon be able to speak evil of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who is not against us is for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone gives you even a cup of water because you belong to the Messiah, I tell you the truth, that person will surely be rewarded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you cause one of these little ones who trusts in me to fall into sin, it would be better for you to be thrown into the sea with a large millstone hung around your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your hand causes you to sin, cut it off. It’s better to enter eternal life with only one hand than to go into the unquenchable fires of hell with two hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your foot causes you to sin, cut it off. It’s better to enter eternal life with only one foot than to be thrown into hell with two feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if your eye causes you to sin, gouge it out. It’s better to enter the Kingdom of God with only one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into hell,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘where the maggots never die and the fire never goes out.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For everyone will be tested with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salt is good for seasoning. But if it loses its flavor, how do you make it salty again? You must have the qualities of salt among yourselves and live in peace with each other.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus left Capernaum and went down to the region of Judea and into the area east of the Jordan River. Once again crowds gathered around him, and as usual he was teaching them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Pharisees came and tried to trap him with this question: “Should a man be allowed to divorce his wife?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them with a question: “What did Moses say in the law about divorce?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Well, he permitted it,” they replied. “He said a man can give his wife a written notice of divorce and send her away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus responded, “He wrote this commandment only as a concession to your hard hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ‘God made them male and female’ from the beginning of creation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This explains why a man leaves his father and mother and is joined to his wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the two are united into one.’ Since they are no longer two but one,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let no one split apart what God has joined together.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, when he was alone with his disciples in the house, they brought up the subject again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries someone else commits adultery against her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a woman divorces her husband and marries someone else, she commits adultery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day some parents brought their children to Jesus so he could touch and bless them. But the disciples scolded the parents for bothering him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw what was happening, he was angry with his disciples. He said to them, “Let the children come to me. Don’t stop them! For the Kingdom of God belongs to those who are like these children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, anyone who doesn’t receive the Kingdom of God like a child will never enter it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took the children in his arms and placed his hands on their heads and blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was starting out on his way to Jerusalem, a man came running up to him, knelt down, and asked, “Good Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you call me good?” Jesus asked. “Only God is truly good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to answer your question, you know the commandments: ‘You must not murder. You must not commit adultery. You must not steal. You must not testify falsely. You must not cheat anyone. Honor your father and mother.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher,” the man replied, “I’ve obeyed all these commandments since I was young.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Looking at the man, Jesus felt genuine love for him. “There is still one thing you haven’t done,” he told him. “Go and sell all your possessions and give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this the man’s face fell, and he went away sad, for he had many possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked around and said to his disciples, “How hard it is for the rich to enter the Kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This amazed them. But Jesus said again, “Dear children, it is very hard to enter the Kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the Kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were astounded. “Then who in the world can be saved?” they asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked at them intently and said, “Humanly speaking, it is impossible. But not with God. Everything is possible with God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter began to speak up. “We’ve given up everything to follow you,” he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yes,” Jesus replied, “and I assure you that everyone who has given up house or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or property, for my sake and for the Good News,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: will receive now in return a hundred times as many houses, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and property—along with persecution. And in the world to come that person will have eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many who are the greatest now will be least important then, and those who seem least important now will be the greatest then.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were now on the way up to Jerusalem, and Jesus was walking ahead of them. The disciples were filled with awe, and the people following behind were overwhelmed with fear. Taking the twelve disciples aside, Jesus once more began to describe everything that was about to happen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen,” he said, “we’re going up to Jerusalem, where the Son of Man will be betrayed to the leading priests and the teachers of religious law. They will sentence him to die and hand him over to the Romans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will mock him, spit on him, flog him with a whip, and kill him, but after three days he will rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came over and spoke to him. “Teacher,” they said, “we want you to do us a favor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What is your request?” he asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They replied, “When you sit on your glorious throne, we want to sit in places of honor next to you, one on your right and the other on your left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, “You don’t know what you are asking! Are you able to drink from the bitter cup of suffering I am about to drink? Are you able to be baptized with the baptism of suffering I must be baptized with?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Oh yes,” they replied, “we are able!”
Then Jesus told them, “You will indeed drink from my bitter cup and be baptized with my baptism of suffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have no right to say who will sit on my right or my left. God has prepared those places for the ones he has chosen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the ten other disciples heard what James and John had asked, they were indignant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus called them together and said, “You know that the rulers in this world lord it over their people, and officials flaunt their authority over those under them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But among you it will be different. Whoever wants to be a leader among you must be your servant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whoever wants to be first among you must be the slave of everyone else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even the Son of Man came not to be served but to serve others and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they reached Jericho, and as Jesus and his disciples left town, a large crowd followed him. A blind beggar named Bartimaeus (son of Timaeus) was sitting beside the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Bartimaeus heard that Jesus of Nazareth was nearby, he began to shout, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Be quiet!” many of the people yelled at him.
But he only shouted louder, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Jesus heard him, he stopped and said, “Tell him to come here.”
So they called the blind man. “Cheer up,” they said. “Come on, he’s calling you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bartimaeus threw aside his coat, jumped up, and came to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What do you want me to do for you?” Jesus asked.
“My Rabbi,” the blind man said, “I want to see!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Go, for your faith has healed you.” Instantly the man could see, and he followed Jesus down the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus and his disciples approached Jerusalem, they came to the towns of Bethphage and Bethany on the Mount of Olives. Jesus sent two of them on ahead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go into that village over there,” he told them. “As soon as you enter it, you will see a young donkey tied there that no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone asks, ‘What are you doing?’ just say, ‘The Lord needs it and will return it soon.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two disciples left and found the colt standing in the street, tied outside the front door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were untying it, some bystanders demanded, “What are you doing, untying that colt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said what Jesus had told them to say, and they were permitted to take it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought the colt to Jesus and threw their garments over it, and he sat on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many in the crowd spread their garments on the road ahead of him, and others spread leafy branches they had cut in the fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus was in the center of the procession, and the people all around him were shouting,
“Praise God!
    Blessings on the one who comes in the name of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessings on the coming Kingdom of our ancestor David!
    Praise God in highest heaven!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus came to Jerusalem and went into the Temple. After looking around carefully at everything, he left because it was late in the afternoon. Then he returned to Bethany with the twelve disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next morning as they were leaving Bethany, Jesus was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He noticed a fig tree in full leaf a little way off, so he went over to see if he could find any figs. But there were only leaves because it was too early in the season for fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the tree, “May no one ever eat your fruit again!” And the disciples heard him say it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they arrived back in Jerusalem, Jesus entered the Temple and began to drive out the people buying and selling animals for sacrifices. He knocked over the tables of the money changers and the chairs of those selling doves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he stopped everyone from using the Temple as a marketplace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “The Scriptures declare, ‘My Temple will be called a house of prayer for all nations,’ but you have turned it into a den of thieves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the leading priests and teachers of religious law heard what Jesus had done, they began planning how to kill him. But they were afraid of him because the people were so amazed at his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That evening Jesus and the disciples left the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next morning as they passed by the fig tree he had cursed, the disciples noticed it had withered from the roots up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter remembered what Jesus had said to the tree on the previous day and exclaimed, “Look, Rabbi! The fig tree you cursed has withered and died!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the disciples, “Have faith in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, you can say to this mountain, ‘May you be lifted up and thrown into the sea,’ and it will happen. But you must really believe it will happen and have no doubt in your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, you can pray for anything, and if you believe that you’ve received it, it will be yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you are praying, first forgive anyone you are holding a grudge against, so that your Father in heaven will forgive your sins, too.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again they entered Jerusalem. As Jesus was walking through the Temple area, the leading priests, the teachers of religious law, and the elders came up to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They demanded, “By what authority are you doing all these things? Who gave you the right to do them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’ll tell you by what authority I do these things if you answer one question,” Jesus replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Did John’s authority to baptize come from heaven, or was it merely human? Answer me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They talked it over among themselves. “If we say it was from heaven, he will ask why we didn’t believe John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But do we dare say it was merely human?” For they were afraid of what the people would do, because everyone believed that John was a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they finally replied, “We don’t know.”
And Jesus responded, “Then I won’t tell you by what authority I do these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus began teaching them with stories: “A man planted a vineyard. He built a wall around it, dug a pit for pressing out the grape juice, and built a lookout tower. Then he leased the vineyard to tenant farmers and moved to another country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the time of the grape harvest, he sent one of his servants to collect his share of the crop.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the farmers grabbed the servant, beat him up, and sent him back empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The owner then sent another servant, but they insulted him and beat him over the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next servant he sent was killed. Others he sent were either beaten or killed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until there was only one left—his son whom he loved dearly. The owner finally sent him, thinking, ‘Surely they will respect my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the tenant farmers said to one another, ‘Here comes the heir to this estate. Let’s kill him and get the estate for ourselves!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they grabbed him and murdered him and threw his body out of the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you suppose the owner of the vineyard will do?” Jesus asked. “I’ll tell you—he will come and kill those farmers and lease the vineyard to others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Didn’t you ever read this in the Scriptures?
‘The stone that the builders rejected
    has now become the cornerstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the Lord’s doing,
    and it is wonderful to see.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders wanted to arrest Jesus because they realized he was telling the story against them—they were the wicked farmers. But they were afraid of the crowd, so they left him and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later the leaders sent some Pharisees and supporters of Herod to trap Jesus into saying something for which he could be arrested.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher,” they said, “we know how honest you are. You are impartial and don’t play favorites. You teach the way of God truthfully. Now tell us—is it right to pay taxes to Caesar or not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should we pay them, or shouldn’t we?”
Jesus saw through their hypocrisy and said, “Why are you trying to trap me? Show me a Roman coin, and I’ll tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they handed it to him, he asked, “Whose picture and title are stamped on it?”
“Caesar’s,” they replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Well, then,” Jesus said, “give to Caesar what belongs to Caesar, and give to God what belongs to God.”
His reply completely amazed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus was approached by some Sadducees—religious leaders who say there is no resurrection from the dead. They posed this question:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, Moses gave us a law that if a man dies, leaving a wife without children, his brother should marry the widow and have a child who will carry on the brother’s name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Well, suppose there were seven brothers. The oldest one married and then died without children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the second brother married the widow, but he also died without children. Then the third brother married her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This continued with all seven of them, and still there were no children. Last of all, the woman also died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So tell us, whose wife will she be in the resurrection? For all seven were married to her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Your mistake is that you don’t know the Scriptures, and you don’t know the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when the dead rise, they will neither marry nor be given in marriage. In this respect they will be like the angels in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But now, as to whether the dead will be raised—haven’t you ever read about this in the writings of Moses, in the story of the burning bush? Long after Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob had died, God said to Moses, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he is the God of the living, not the dead. You have made a serious error.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the teachers of religious law was standing there listening to the debate. He realized that Jesus had answered well, so he asked, “Of all the commandments, which is the most important?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “The most important commandment is this: ‘Listen, O Israel! The Lord our God is the one and only Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you must love the Lord your God with all your heart, all your soul, all your mind, and all your strength.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second is equally important: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’ No other commandment is greater than these.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The teacher of religious law replied, “Well said, Teacher. You have spoken the truth by saying that there is only one God and no other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I know it is important to love him with all my heart and all my understanding and all my strength, and to love my neighbor as myself. This is more important than to offer all of the burnt offerings and sacrifices required in the law.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Realizing how much the man understood, Jesus said to him, “You are not far from the Kingdom of God.” And after that, no one dared to ask him any more questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, as Jesus was teaching the people in the Temple, he asked, “Why do the teachers of religious law claim that the Messiah is the son of David?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For David himself, speaking under the inspiration of the Holy Spirit, said,
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
Sit in the place of honor at my right hand
    until I humble your enemies beneath your feet.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since David himself called the Messiah ‘my Lord,’ how can the Messiah be his son?” The large crowd listened to him with great delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus also taught: “Beware of these teachers of religious law! For they like to parade around in flowing robes and receive respectful greetings as they walk in the marketplaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And how they love the seats of honor in the synagogues and the head table at banquets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they shamelessly cheat widows out of their property and then pretend to be pious by making long prayers in public. Because of this, they will be more severely punished.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sat down near the collection box in the Temple and watched as the crowds dropped in their money. Many rich people put in large amounts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a poor widow came and dropped in two small coins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called his disciples to him and said, “I tell you the truth, this poor widow has given more than all the others who are making contributions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they gave a tiny part of their surplus, but she, poor as she is, has given everything she had to live on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was leaving the Temple that day, one of his disciples said, “Teacher, look at these magnificent buildings! Look at the impressive stones in the walls.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Yes, look at these great buildings. But they will be completely demolished. Not one stone will be left on top of another!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
