verses.text: Later, Jesus sat on the Mount of Olives across the valley from the Temple. Peter, James, John, and Andrew came to him privately and asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell us, when will all this happen? What sign will show us that these things are about to be fulfilled?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Don’t let anyone mislead you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for many will come in my name, claiming, ‘I am the Messiah.’ They will deceive many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will hear of wars and threats of wars, but don’t panic. Yes, these things must take place, but the end won’t follow immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nation will go to war against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in many parts of the world, as well as famines. But this is only the first of the birth pains, with more to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When these things begin to happen, watch out! You will be handed over to the local councils and beaten in the synagogues. You will stand trial before governors and kings because you are my followers. But this will be your opportunity to tell them about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Good News must first be preached to all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you are arrested and stand trial, don’t worry in advance about what to say. Just say what God tells you at that time, for it is not you who will be speaking, but the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A brother will betray his brother to death, a father will betray his own child, and children will rebel against their parents and cause them to be killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone will hate you because you are my followers. But the one who endures to the end will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The day is coming when you will see the sacrilegious object that causes desecration standing where he should not be.” (Reader, pay attention!) “Then those in Judea must flee to the hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A person out on the deck of a roof must not go down into the house to pack.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A person out in the field must not return even to get a coat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How terrible it will be for pregnant women and for nursing mothers in those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And pray that your flight will not be in winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there will be greater anguish in those days than at any time since God created the world. And it will never be so great again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, unless the Lord shortens that time of calamity, not a single person will survive. But for the sake of his chosen ones he has shortened those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then if anyone tells you, ‘Look, here is the Messiah,’ or ‘There he is,’ don’t believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For false messiahs and false prophets will rise up and perform signs and wonders so as to deceive, if possible, even God’s chosen ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch out! I have warned you about this ahead of time!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“At that time, after the anguish of those days,
the sun will be darkened,
    the moon will give no light,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the stars will fall from the sky,
    and the powers in the heavens will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then everyone will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds with great power and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will send out his angels to gather his chosen ones from all over the world—from the farthest ends of the earth and heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now learn a lesson from the fig tree. When its branches bud and its leaves begin to sprout, you know that summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, when you see all these things taking place, you can know that his return is very near, right at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, this generation will not pass from the scene before all these things take place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will disappear, but my words will never disappear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “However, no one knows the day or hour when these things will happen, not even the angels in heaven or the Son himself. Only the Father knows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And since you don’t know when that time will come, be on guard! Stay alert!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The coming of the Son of Man can be illustrated by the story of a man going on a long trip. When he left home, he gave each of his slaves instructions about the work they were to do, and he told the gatekeeper to watch for his return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, too, must keep watch! For you don’t know when the master of the household will return—in the evening, at midnight, before dawn, or at daybreak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t let him find you sleeping when he arrives without warning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say to you what I say to everyone: Watch for him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was now two days before Passover and the Festival of Unleavened Bread. The leading priests and the teachers of religious law were still looking for an opportunity to capture Jesus secretly and kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But not during the Passover celebration,” they agreed, “or the people may riot.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, Jesus was in Bethany at the home of Simon, a man who had previously had leprosy. While he was eating, a woman came in with a beautiful alabaster jar of expensive perfume made from essence of nard. She broke open the jar and poured the perfume over his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of those at the table were indignant. “Why waste such expensive perfume?” they asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It could have been sold for a year’s wages and the money given to the poor!” So they scolded her harshly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus replied, “Leave her alone. Why criticize her for doing such a good thing to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will always have the poor among you, and you can help them whenever you want to. But you will not always have me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She has done what she could and has anointed my body for burial ahead of time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, wherever the Good News is preached throughout the world, this woman’s deed will be remembered and discussed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve disciples, went to the leading priests to arrange to betray Jesus to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were delighted when they heard why he had come, and they promised to give him money. So he began looking for an opportunity to betray Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, when the Passover lamb is sacrificed, Jesus’ disciples asked him, “Where do you want us to go to prepare the Passover meal for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus sent two of them into Jerusalem with these instructions: “As you go into the city, a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you. Follow him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the house he enters, say to the owner, ‘The Teacher asks: Where is the guest room where I can eat the Passover meal with my disciples?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take you upstairs to a large room that is already set up. That is where you should prepare our meal.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the two disciples went into the city and found everything just as Jesus had said, and they prepared the Passover meal there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the evening Jesus arrived with the Twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were at the table eating, Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, one of you eating with me here will betray me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greatly distressed, each one asked in turn, “Am I the one?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “It is one of you twelve who is eating from this bowl with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man must die, as the Scriptures declared long ago. But how terrible it will be for the one who betrays him. It would be far better for that man if he had never been born!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were eating, Jesus took some bread and blessed it. Then he broke it in pieces and gave it to the disciples, saying, “Take it, for this is my body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took a cup of wine and gave thanks to God for it. He gave it to them, and they all drank from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “This is my blood, which confirms the covenant between God and his people. It is poured out as a sacrifice for many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, I will not drink wine again until the day I drink it new in the Kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sang a hymn and went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the way, Jesus told them, “All of you will desert me. For the Scriptures say,
‘God will strike the Shepherd,
    and the sheep will be scattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after I am raised from the dead, I will go ahead of you to Galilee and meet you there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “Even if everyone else deserts you, I never will.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I tell you the truth, Peter—this very night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny three times that you even know me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No!” Peter declared emphatically. “Even if I have to die with you, I will never deny you!” And all the others vowed the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went to the olive grove called Gethsemane, and Jesus said, “Sit here while I go and pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took Peter, James, and John with him, and he became deeply troubled and distressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “My soul is crushed with grief to the point of death. Stay here and keep watch with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went on a little farther and fell to the ground. He prayed that, if it were possible, the awful hour awaiting him might pass him by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Abba, Father,” he cried out, “everything is possible for you. Please take this cup of suffering away from me. Yet I want your will to be done, not mine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he returned and found the disciples asleep. He said to Peter, “Simon, are you asleep? Couldn’t you watch with me even one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep watch and pray, so that you will not give in to temptation. For the spirit is willing, but the body is weak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus left them again and prayed the same prayer as before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he returned to them again, he found them sleeping, for they couldn’t keep their eyes open. And they didn’t know what to say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he returned to them the third time, he said, “Go ahead and sleep. Have your rest. But no—the time has come. The Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Up, let’s be going. Look, my betrayer is here!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately, even as Jesus said this, Judas, one of the twelve disciples, arrived with a crowd of men armed with swords and clubs. They had been sent by the leading priests, the teachers of religious law, and the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The traitor, Judas, had given them a prearranged signal: “You will know which one to arrest when I greet him with a kiss. Then you can take him away under guard.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as they arrived, Judas walked up to Jesus. “Rabbi!” he exclaimed, and gave him the kiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the others grabbed Jesus and arrested him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one of the men with Jesus pulled out his sword and struck the high priest’s slave, slashing off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked them, “Am I some dangerous revolutionary, that you come with swords and clubs to arrest me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why didn’t you arrest me in the Temple? I was there among you teaching every day. But these things are happening to fulfill what the Scriptures say about me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all his disciples deserted him and ran away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One young man following behind was clothed only in a long linen shirt. When the mob tried to grab him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he slipped out of his shirt and ran away naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took Jesus to the high priest’s home where the leading priests, the elders, and the teachers of religious law had gathered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, Peter followed him at a distance and went right into the high priest’s courtyard. There he sat with the guards, warming himself by the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Inside, the leading priests and the entire high council were trying to find evidence against Jesus, so they could put him to death. But they couldn’t find any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many false witnesses spoke against him, but they contradicted each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, some men stood up and gave this false testimony:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this Temple made with human hands, and in three days I will build another, made without human hands.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even then they didn’t get their stories straight!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest stood up before the others and asked Jesus, “Well, aren’t you going to answer these charges? What do you have to say for yourself?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus was silent and made no reply. Then the high priest asked him, “Are you the Messiah, the Son of the Blessed One?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “I am. And you will see the Son of Man seated in the place of power at God’s right hand and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest tore his clothing to show his horror and said, “Why do we need other witnesses?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have all heard his blasphemy. What is your verdict?”
“Guilty!” they all cried. “He deserves to die!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of them began to spit at him, and they blindfolded him and beat him with their fists. “Prophesy to us,” they jeered. And the guards slapped him as they took him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, Peter was in the courtyard below. One of the servant girls who worked for the high priest came by
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and noticed Peter warming himself at the fire. She looked at him closely and said, “You were one of those with Jesus of Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter denied it. “I don’t know what you’re talking about,” he said, and he went out into the entryway. Just then, a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the servant girl saw him standing there, she began telling the others, “This man is definitely one of them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Peter denied it again.
A little later some of the other bystanders confronted Peter and said, “You must be one of them, because you are a Galilean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter swore, “A curse on me if I’m lying—I don’t know this man you’re talking about!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And immediately the rooster crowed the second time.
Suddenly, Jesus’ words flashed through Peter’s mind: “Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny three times that you even know me.” And he broke down and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Very early in the morning the leading priests, the elders, and the teachers of religious law—the entire high council—met to discuss their next step. They bound Jesus, led him away, and took him to Pilate, the Roman governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate asked Jesus, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
Jesus replied, “You have said it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the leading priests kept accusing him of many crimes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Pilate asked him, “Aren’t you going to answer them? What about all these charges they are bringing against you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said nothing, much to Pilate’s surprise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was the governor’s custom each year during the Passover celebration to release one prisoner—anyone the people requested.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the prisoners at that time was Barabbas, a revolutionary who had committed murder in an uprising.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd went to Pilate and asked him to release a prisoner as usual.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Would you like me to release to you this ‘King of the Jews’?” Pilate asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For he realized by now that the leading priests had arrested Jesus out of envy.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But at this point the leading priests stirred up the crowd to demand the release of Barabbas instead of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate asked them, “Then what should I do with this man you call the king of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shouted back, “Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why?” Pilate demanded. “What crime has he committed?”
But the mob roared even louder, “Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So to pacify the crowd, Pilate released Barabbas to them. He ordered Jesus flogged with a lead-tipped whip, then turned him over to the Roman soldiers to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers took Jesus into the courtyard of the governor’s headquarters (called the Praetorium) and called out the entire regiment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They dressed him in a purple robe, and they wove thorn branches into a crown and put it on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they saluted him and taunted, “Hail! King of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they struck him on the head with a reed stick, spit on him, and dropped to their knees in mock worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were finally tired of mocking him, they took off the purple robe and put his own clothes on him again. Then they led him away to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A passerby named Simon, who was from Cyrene, was coming in from the countryside just then, and the soldiers forced him to carry Jesus’ cross. (Simon was the father of Alexander and Rufus.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought Jesus to a place called Golgotha (which means “Place of the Skull”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They offered him wine drugged with myrrh, but he refused it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers nailed him to the cross. They divided his clothes and threw dice to decide who would get each piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was nine o’clock in the morning when they crucified him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A sign announced the charge against him. It read, “The King of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two revolutionaries were crucified with him, one on his right and one on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people passing by shouted abuse, shaking their heads in mockery. “Ha! Look at you now!” they yelled at him. “You said you were going to destroy the Temple and rebuild it in three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Well then, save yourself and come down from the cross!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leading priests and teachers of religious law also mocked Jesus. “He saved others,” they scoffed, “but he can’t save himself!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let this Messiah, this King of Israel, come down from the cross so we can see it and believe him!” Even the men who were crucified with Jesus ridiculed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At noon, darkness fell across the whole land until three o’clock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then at three o’clock Jesus called out with a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?” which means “My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the bystanders misunderstood and thought he was calling for the prophet Elijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them ran and filled a sponge with sour wine, holding it up to him on a reed stick so he could drink. “Wait!” he said. “Let’s see whether Elijah comes to take him down!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus uttered another loud cry and breathed his last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the curtain in the sanctuary of the Temple was torn in two, from top to bottom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Roman officer who stood facing him saw how he had died, he exclaimed, “This man truly was the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some women were there, watching from a distance, including Mary Magdalene, Mary (the mother of James the younger and of Joseph), and Salome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had been followers of Jesus and had cared for him while he was in Galilee. Many other women who had come with him to Jerusalem were also there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This all happened on Friday, the day of preparation, the day before the Sabbath. As evening approached,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph of Arimathea took a risk and went to Pilate and asked for Jesus’ body. (Joseph was an honored member of the high council, and he was waiting for the Kingdom of God to come.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate couldn’t believe that Jesus was already dead, so he called for the Roman officer and asked if he had died yet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officer confirmed that Jesus was dead, so Pilate told Joseph he could have the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph bought a long sheet of linen cloth. Then he took Jesus’ body down from the cross, wrapped it in the cloth, and laid it in a tomb that had been carved out of the rock. Then he rolled a stone in front of the entrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joseph saw where Jesus’ body was laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saturday evening, when the Sabbath ended, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome went out and purchased burial spices so they could anoint Jesus’ body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Very early on Sunday morning, just at sunrise, they went to the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the way they were asking each other, “Who will roll away the stone for us from the entrance to the tomb?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as they arrived, they looked up and saw that the stone, which was very large, had already been rolled aside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they entered the tomb, they saw a young man clothed in a white robe sitting on the right side. The women were shocked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the angel said, “Don’t be alarmed. You are looking for Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He isn’t here! He is risen from the dead! Look, this is where they laid his body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now go and tell his disciples, including Peter, that Jesus is going ahead of you to Galilee. You will see him there, just as he told you before he died.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The women fled from the tomb, trembling and bewildered, and they said nothing to anyone because they were too frightened.
Then they briefly reported all this to Peter and his companions. Afterward Jesus himself sent them out from east to west with the sacred and unfailing message of salvation that gives eternal life. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus rose from the dead early on Sunday morning, the first person who saw him was Mary Magdalene, the woman from whom he had cast out seven demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went to the disciples, who were grieving and weeping, and told them what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when she told them that Jesus was alive and she had seen him, they didn’t believe her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward he appeared in a different form to two of his followers who were walking from Jerusalem into the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They rushed back to tell the others, but no one believed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still later he appeared to the eleven disciples as they were eating together. He rebuked them for their stubborn unbelief because they refused to believe those who had seen him after he had been raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then he told them, “Go into all the world and preach the Good News to everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who believes and is baptized will be saved. But anyone who refuses to believe will be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These miraculous signs will accompany those who believe: They will cast out demons in my name, and they will speak in new languages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be able to handle snakes with safety, and if they drink anything poisonous, it won’t hurt them. They will be able to place their hands on the sick, and they will be healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord Jesus had finished talking with them, he was taken up into heaven and sat down in the place of honor at God’s right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples went everywhere and preached, and the Lord worked through them, confirming what they said by many miraculous signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator
